Trial_Design.evidence: 25 patients with TRD during a 1-year, open-label, maintenance period

Participants.evidence: 25 patients with TRD during a 1-year, open-label, maintenance period

Intervention.evidence: DBS targeted at the ventral anterior limb of the internal capsule (vALIC)

Objective.evidence: Our objective was to assess the efficacy and safety of DBS targeted at the ventral anterior limb of the internal capsule (vALIC)

Method_Outcome.evidence: Primary outcomes were response rate (≥50% HAM-D-17 score reduction) after the maintenance phase, approximately 2 years after DBS surgery

Number_Randomised.evidence: Of 25 operated patients, 21 entered and 18 completed the maintenance phase

Number_Analysed.evidence: eight patients were classified as responder (observed response rate: 44.4%; intention-to-treat: 32.0%)

Result_Outcome.evidence: the mean IDS-SR score decreased from 38.8 (95% CI 31.2 to 46.5) to 35.0 (95% CI 26.1 to 43.8) (p=0.008)

Harms.evidence: Four non-DBS-related serious adverse events occurred, including one suicide attempt
